body:
Nice one - thanks.

You even updated the Spanish readme ;)

This project looks pretty cool! I wrote a gem a while back https://github.com/jwoertink/tourets that could be good for it. I don't work in this field anymore, so I haven't had the chance to really work on it. If you're interested in it, I can make you a maintainer on it, and help out where I can.

@jwoertink thanks for reaching out - great to hear from you!

Just had a look at tourets - it looks ideal for my use case.  Right now I'm still busy fixing some bugs, adding tests etc.  I hope to be able to start work on RETS integration in the next couple of weeks or so.  At that point I will give tourets a spin and see if it works out for me.

The only thing I see right now that might be an issue is that its built on the placester RETS gem which is not being maintained anymore.  If its fairly easy to swap that out for the estately rets gem ([https://github.com/estately/rets](https://github.com/estately/rets)) then I'll try to do that.

Yes, please make me a maintainer and I'll try to contribute.

One more thing - did you happen to find some RETS servers against which I could try things out with test credentials?

My master branch is way out of date, but I have a rails branch that already has the placester gem ripped out. As far as I know, you have to pay to have access to the MLS and RETS. The idea behind TouRETS though was for an easy rails integration while being able to support multiple RETS server. 

I'll add you on there, and we can work on making it more solid. Maybe @russ would like to get in on this action?
Thanks @jwoertink - got your invite.  I'll look into it as soon as I get the chance.

Just found out today about an initiative to make it easier to access MLS data for development purposes.  Applying for access now.  Hope it makes things easier.

http://www.inman.com/2017/01/26/free-mls-data-feed-could-speed-up-real-estate-innovation/amp/

![pwb_iphone_landing](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1741198/22990222/bfec0168-f3b8-11e6-89df-b950c4979970.png)

landing page on an iphone

Hey @cvillalba, thanks for trying it out.

I am guessing that you created a new rails project and added pwb as a gem to that project.

If that is the case can you try adding the globalize gem to your rails project by adding this line to your gemfile:

gem 'globalize', git: 'https://github.com/globalize/globalize'

@cvillalba glad it is working.

To see the app when you browse to the root you will have to mount it in your routes.rb file like so:
  mount Pwb::Engine => '/'

I will update the documentation.

BTW, are you a native Spanish speaker?  I want to have the documentation available in different languages so I would appreciate some help in keeping this document updated in Spanish:

https://github.com/etewiah/property_web_builder/blob/master/README_es.md

Also, you can install migrations etc with these commands:


rails pwb:install:migrations
rails db:create
rails db:migrate
rails pwb:db:seed

Hey 

About the documentation, yes I'm native Spanish speaker and I happy to help with the translation. I'll send a PR as soon as I can.

Sorry to bother you again, but I'm getting an error when I run `rails db:migrate`:
`NoMethodError: undefined method `configure' for MoneyRails:Module`

I'm really new in ruby on rails, so sorry about all the questions.

Cheers

No worries - it seems an older version of MoneyRails is used if you have it installed.  I have fixed this by specifying the minimum version of MoneyRails needed in the engine's gemspec.

Update to the fixed version by running  "bundle update pwb" and try again.

Also, make sure you are using postgres as your database - I just now updated the readme with that.

If you come across any other issues, please open a new issue so I can track it separately.

Cheers,

Ed

I currently have a solution for theming which needs a bit more testing before it is rolled out.  It works by having different folders located here for each theme:

https://github.com/etewiah/property_web_builder/tree/master/app/themes

In the application_controller I have a set_theme_path method that reads the “theme_name” value for the current agency.
It then uses prepend_view_path to add the theme path to the list of locations that rails will check for a template.  The best explanation of how prepend_view_path works can be found here:  

http://climber2002.github.io/blog/2015/04/06/digging-rails-how-rails-finds-your-templates-part-4/

The set_theme_path method also sets the self.class.layout value.

Until I implement an admin page section for changing themes, the easiest way to experiment with the themes feature is to run the following from the rails console:

```ruby
agency = Pwb::Agency.unique_instance
agency.theme_name = "berlin"
agency.save!
```

Thanks 

That fixed it, but I had another problema that i'll report in other issue.

btw already started with the spanish update in a branch that I just create.

thanks again

@cvillalba - could you check which version of postgres you are using by running "postgres -V"?

I believe json support in postgres was added in version 9.2 so you will need to have at least that version.
Great - looking forward to the Spanish translation ;)
Thanks @cvillalba, I appreciate that.

@etewiah I think I have a version that should work. 

```
$ psql --version
psql (PostgreSQL) 9.4.10

```

Cheers

I'm using 9.5.1 but I'd expect what you have to work as well.

Send me an email ( ed at propertywebbuilder.com ) and lets setup a skype call so I can troubleshoot with you.
We would love to provide you german and french translations. Let me know how to start.

Hurraaaay!  That's great.  Thanks for offering to help.

The files that need translation are here:

https://github.com/etewiah/property_web_builder/tree/master/config/locales

Each file ends with a ".language_code.yml" extension so as you can see all that remains for me to complete the French translations is the admin.fr.yml file.

For the German translations I need to start from scratch.  I can obtain the translations for devise.de.yml and rails.de.yml so don't worry about those - I will add them in the next few hours.

It will be really great to have the remaining translations done.  Are you familiar with pull requests?

There are also some seed files that I use to populate the website with example data.  It would be good to translate those too but first I need to figure out a better way of organising them.

If anything is not clear or you have any questions, just let me know.  If you wish, we could arrange a skype call to discuss any issues.

Thanks again for offering to help.
Hi Carlos, can you confirm that after our call last night everything is working fine and I can close this issue?

Thank you for pointing out that my database configuration was wrong.
I haven't try going further but the error mentioned here is no longer sowing up.

Thanks again, cheers
Hi @beeyatch, I never heard back from you.  Still able to help?
@etewiah I can help with German, not much with French though.

Hi Ed, sorry I didn't answer earlier.

It actually worked perfect. I did have another issue though when the app
was already up and running, I opened an issue in github to give more
visibility.

Thanks again for all your help

Take care

2017-03-30 8:43 GMT-04:00 Ed Tewiah <notifications@github.com>:

> Hi Carlos, can you confirm that after our call last night everything is
> working fine and I can close this issue?
>
> —

> .

-- 

Carlos Antonio Villalba Julio.-
@cvillalba that would be awesome.  Are my instructions clear enough for you to be able to start on that?
@etewiah yeah, no problem. It will be done in a couple of days

Hi @cvillalba, that is indeed a bug - thanks for pointing it out.

I will try to have a fix by Monday ( can't promise but will try ;)

In the meantime you can work around this by going to the console and running:

```
wb = Pwb::Website.unique_instance
wb.theme_name = "default"
wb.save!
```
